Race.SpecificTitle: City Judge -- City Court, ES 2E, City of Baton Rouge
Chaneyville Fire Protection Dist. No. 7 -- 10 Mills - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, on behalf of the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a ten (10) mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $80,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the tax collection for the year 2018, to and including the year 2027, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Pride Fire Protection Dist. No. 8 -- 15 Mills - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, on behalf of the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a fifteen (15) mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $187,650 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2018, and annually thereafter, to and including the year 2027, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District 6 -- 10 Mills Renewal - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Fire Protection District 6, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under Article VI, Sections 19, 30 and 32 of the Louisiana Constitution, Part I of Chapter 7 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, and Louisiana Revised Statute 40:1501, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to renew, and adopt a resolution providing for the renewal of, the levy and collection of the expiring ad valorem property tax of ten (10) mills (the "Tax") in each calendar year on the property subject to such taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, from and including the year 2018 to and including the year 2027, which estimated amount of such Tax reasonably expected to be collected is approximately $288,202.90 for each entire year of the levy, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and fire hydrants within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: East Side Fire Protection Dist. No. 5 -- 5 Mills Renewal - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: East Side Fire Protection District No. 5 Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall East Side Fire Protection District No. 5 of East Baton Rouge Parish, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under Article VI, Sections 19, 30, and 32 of the Louisiana Constitution, Part I of Chapter 7 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, Louisiana Revised Statute 40:1501, and all other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to adopt a resolution providing for the renewal of, and renew, the levy and collection of the ad valorem property tax of five (5) mills (the "Tax"), expiring in tax year 2017, in each calendar year on property subject to taxation in the District for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in year 2018 and annually thereafter to and including year 2027, which estimated amount of such Tax reasonably expected to be collected is approximately $441,417.70 for each entire year of the levy, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Visit Baton Rouge -- 2% Hotel Tax - BOD - Perp.
Race.FullText: Shall Visit Baton Rouge, a political subdivision of the State of Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect an additional two (2%) percent tax upon the paid occupancy of hotel rooms located within East Baton Rouge Parish, but not located within the municipalities of Baker, Central, or Zachary, or the area within the boundaries of the Baton Rouge North Economic Development District, (an estimated $3,320,488 is reasonably expected to be collected from such hotel occupancy tax for an entire year), commencing on April 1, 2018, and thereafter, in perpetuity, to be levied and collected by Visit Baton Rouge and used (after paying reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering such tax) fifty percent (50%) for the operation, maintenance, and construction of the Raising Cane's River Center, and fifty percent (50%) for the operational and capital expenses of Visit Baton Rouge?
